newsitem.title: SWEDEN: Stena Line sells 2 ferries for $15.2 mln.
newsitem.headline: Stena Line sells 2 ferries for $15.2 mln.

text.p: Ferry operator Stena Line said on Tuesday it was selling its Lion Queen and Stena Adventurer ferries to the Stena Group for $15.2 million.
The Stena AB group is an unlisted shipping company that owns part of Stena Line.
A company spokesman told Reuters that Stena AB would in turn sell on the ferries but it was up to the company to announce this transaction.
He said the ferries were surplus to Stena Line's requirements.
Stena Line said in a statement that the sale of the two ferries, which are the oldest and smallest in its fleet, would have a negative impact of about 27 million crowns on its 1997 results.
Stena Adventurer was built in 1977 at Denmark's Aalborg shipyard and the Lion Queen was built in 1967 at the Lindholmen shipyard in Gothenburg, western Sweden.
The ferry operator said it had no plans to sell any further ships.
